content.raw:
The line `include(IgnPkgConfig)` should always be safe.

As far as I can figure, calling `ign_pkg_check_modules[_quiet]` should also be safe on Windows, it just might not accomplish anything since pkg-config might not be available.

Have you run into issues where calling one of the `IgnPkgConfig` macros causes an error or warning? If so, that's something that should be fixed in `IgnPkgConfig`.
content.html:
The line include(IgnPkgConfig) should always be safe.

As far as I can figure, calling ign_pkg_check_modules[_quiet] should also be safe on Windows, it just might not accomplish anything since pkg-config might not be available.

Have you run into issues where calling one of the IgnPkgConfig macros causes an error or warning? If so, that's something that should be fixed in IgnPkgConfig.
